reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the best location in Totnes. Stayed in the beautiful Agatha Christie suite where every facility was provided. Despite having a recent fire there was no evidence of this apart from the car park being closed but arrangements had been made by the hotel to park in the adjacent Morrisons car park, and we were informed of this by a telephone call prior to our stay. Staff friendly and helpful. All in all we had a great time and will definitely return.
reviews.title: Lovely long weekend break

reviews.text: Very comfortable.I love the log fire.

reviews.title: 70th Birthday Party
An excellent lunch!
reviews.text: Good sandwiches are always difficult to find these days - they are either soggy, have low quality bread, have almost no filling or are some great big doorstep or baguette that nobody wants. Not at the Royal Seven Stars!
I had a ham sandwich here for lunch today and it was 100% perfect! The best I've had for many years. Well done and I highly recommend it for lunch.
reviews.title: an absolute delight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the first time I've stayed at the Seven Stars since it was refurbished some years ago, and I must say they've done a superb job. The room and bathroom were lovely. Both a good size (I was in a premium room). Very nice decor, attractive furnishings, very comfortable bed, great bathroom with separate shower and such good water pressure that it took about two minutes to run a bath. The bathroom had a window, which to me makes a big difference. Nice toiletries in the bathroom, and in decanters rather than the usual packaging-intensive offerings. Very pleasing decor in public spaces too. Excellent breakfast and dinner. And last but not least, delightful staff! All in all, the Seven Stars ticked all myboxes and is definitely in the top three most comfortable hotels I've ever stayed in.
reviews.title: best room in ages
In the heart of the "action"
reviews.text: the room was lovely,large and bright. great big bathroom with seperate shower [1st time ever] spotlessly clean . only petty comments i can make are that the bin had rubbish in [ this included some medication of some sort] and the toilet roll was left with only a few sheets on it [ chambermaid,bin them when they are this low] also the shower jetted all over the cubicle wall and wouldnt adjust down onto the person getting washed so i would change that . the breakfast was amazing,way too much food even for us lol even had hogs pudding in the fry up mmm . take ear plugs as this hotel is on a reletavely busy junction and our room was by a bus stop , windows open as room was hot [was a hot day tho] and traffic noise was on and off [fans are supplied in rooms] . dont let this put you off as the sleep quality , comfy bed, quality linen far out weighs the bad points. nice lively hotel bar . drinks are a little pricey but hey , we were on a break :) parking was a problem as only had a small car park

An ideal hotel right in the centre of Totnes, and provides a good hub for visiting this area of Devon. We've had three visits, and each time we've been impressed with the great service from the staff and comfortable surroundings.
reviews.title: lovely!!

reviews.text: It’s great to still read so many positive comments about the Hotel
reviews.title: Long Overdue Review!

reviews.text: We have just booked up again for the 2012/2013 New Year Celebrations, returning after we enjoyed it so much last year (2011/2012) – The booking couldn’t have been easier, whilst unable to do so on line, it was nice to have some human intervention, and the lady who took the booking should be congratulated!

reviews.title: Couple of days at the Seven Stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in the Royal Seven Stars in October shortly after they had experienced a kitchen fire. The staff informed us of this straight away and it didnt seem to make any difference to our stay. The rooms are directly above the pub and restaurant but very safe and quiet. Although small, the rooms have a lot of character and everything you need - TV, tea and coffee making facilities, full ensuite bath and shower room. Its in the perfect location for the main street and a lot of choice of shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: Great stay in a great location

reviews.text: The location is great, right at then end of Fore Street. Everywhere is within easy walking distance. Make sure you visit some of the wonderful cafes in the town, spoilt for choice, and if you are there on Fridays, make sure you get to the Flea market in Market Square. My room was lovely, comfortable and very clean, I did however have to turn off the radiators, but I was able to to this myself. I was there over Halloween, so it was a bit noisy in the street that night, but other nights were much quieter. I ate in the bar on two evenings and the food was very good. I recommend trying the Fisherman's Pie. I thought the staff did very well considering they were working out of a temporary kitchen due to fire damage. I was advised ahead by telephone of the parking arrangements at Morrison's. I enjoyed my stay and would happily stay again in the future.
reviews.title: In the center of Totnes
Excellent place, but no good service in restaurant
reviews.text: Is a very good place if you want a quiet evening with music, or meet new people. The service in bar is excellent and the food is good, but in the afternoon the service for eat is veeery slow! I recommend Seven Star for a good evening with friends!
Went to this hotel with large family gathering. Very friendly staff and the Doombar is delicious! The staff were baby friendly and there was a lovely atmosphere.
reviews.title: Friendly and historic

reviews.text: Totnes is a beautiful, historic town and has a superb cheese shop.
reviews.title: interesting time warp
